meta.title: Jemima’s Asking — Natural Style Question Config (Progressive Ramp)
meta.tone: Bright, witty, lightly camp; precise when academic.
goals: Maintain short/medium/long cadence per side in each round while lengthening across the game.
Guarantee exactly one certainly correct answer and three certainly wrong distractors (all retained even if not served).
Keep voice natural first with verification-grade clarity and explicit scope markers.

round_plan.notes: Keep openings breezy with everyday hooks; single-step recall, zero specialist jargon.
Layer one extra clue (date, place, mechanism) while keeping language accessible.
Introduce comparative phrasing or cause-and-effect; assume engaged enthusiast knowledge.
Expect niche terminology with definitions in-line; highlight why each option differs subtly.
Use layered clues tying era, location, and consequence together; ensure fairness via concrete data.

single_topic_seeds: One colour only (e.g., green) across arts/science/history
Numbers & neat maths (mental arithmetic, ratios, quick proofs)
Clever geography (capitals, borders, curious place facts)
quirks: Playful metaphor no more than once per round.
Exactly one gentle brain-teaser per round.

ban_phrases: in the context of this question
do: Prefer concrete nouns and strong verbs
Use British spellings and metric units (metre, litre, kilogram, £/€ by context)
Disambiguate time/place if needed (add year/country to make truth unique)

round_bias.1: Serve medium distractor; easy and hard stored for audits only.
round_bias.4: Serve easy distractor despite hard question to give recovery window.
round_bias.5: Serve medium distractor for balanced finale.

topic_catalogue: Great Inventions of the Industrial Age

hostItems.items_shape: questionItem(short, medium, long in that order)

guestItems.items_shape: questionItem(short, medium, long in that order)

provenance_hint.description: Tiny non-spoiler anchor (e.g., 'Pont du Gard aqueduct, Roman France'); not shown to players.

prompt_addendum: Respect round_plan length bands to achieve progressive lengthening.
Do not reuse or paraphrase any sample question provided in this config.

checks: Plausible yet false distractors with distinct error types

postprocess.ban_regex: (?i)\b(evaluate the (statement|claim)|choose the option|the following is true/false)\b

sample_questions_policy.usage: Examples exist solely to brief generators and reviewers.
sample_questions_policy.ban_on_reuse: Never surface or paraphrase these examples in live packs or drafts.
sample_questions_policy.enforcement: Automated duplication check runs on stem, answer, and named entities.

sample_questions.subject: Everyday Science
sample_questions.question: Which kitchen acid makes bicarbonate of soda release carbon dioxide bubbles in a quick bread batter?

sample_questions.subject: British & Irish Landmarks
sample_questions.question: Which Irish city’s River Corrib is spanned by the Salmon Weir Bridge built in 1818?

sample_questions.subject: World Capitals
sample_questions.question: Which country moved its capital from Alma-Ata to a purpose-built city renamed Astana in 1998?

sample_questions.subject: Famous Inventions
sample_questions.question: Which inventor patented the folding safety razor in the United States in 1904?

sample_questions.subject: Space & Astronomy
sample_questions.question: Which 17th-century astronomer logged the 1610 Jovian moons and later served as chief mathematician to the Medici court in Florence?

sample_questions.subject: Human Body
sample_questions.question: Which cranial nerve controls most facial expressions and carries taste from the anterior two-thirds of the tongue?

sample_questions.subject: The Internet & Technology
sample_questions.question: Which protocol introduced in 2003 lets email servers verify domain ownership by comparing public DNS keys before accepting messages?

sample_questions.subject: Ancient Civilisations
sample_questions.question: Which Bronze Age civilisation built the palace complex at Phaistos on Crete with a disk inscribed in a spiral script?

sample_questions.subject: British Monarchs
sample_questions.question: Which monarch issued the 1707 Act of Union joining the Kingdoms of England and Scotland into Great Britain?

sample_questions.subject: Irish History
sample_questions.question: Which 1913 dispute over Dublin tramway workers led to the formation of the Irish Citizen Army?

sample_questions.subject: World Wars
sample_questions.question: Which 1941 conference set Allied grand strategy by coordinating British and Soviet forces on the Eastern Front?

sample_questions.subject: The Tudors
sample_questions.question: Which 1536 act dissolved smaller English monasteries to bolster Henry VIII’s finances after the Pilgrimage of Grace?

sample_questions.subject: 20th-Century Milestones
sample_questions.question: Which treaty signed in 1957 founded the European Economic Community by committing six nations to a common market and customs union?

sample_questions.subject: Rebellions & Revolutions
sample_questions.question: Which 1831 uprising led by Nat Turner in Southampton County, Virginia, prompted stricter slave codes across the American South?

sample_questions.subject: Famous Explorers
sample_questions.question: Which Norwegian explorer completed the first successful expedition through the Northwest Passage aboard the Gjøa between 1903 and 1906?

sample_questions.subject: Great Inventions of the Industrial Age
sample_questions.question: Which engineer’s 1804 locomotive named Pen-y-Darren hauled iron on plateways in South Wales and demonstrated steam traction’s freight potential?

sample_questions.subject: Modern Politics
sample_questions.question: Which 1998 accord established the Northern Ireland Assembly, cross-border institutions, and consent principle for constitutional change?

sample_questions.subject: European Cities
sample_questions.question: Which Belgian city hosts the Ghent Altarpiece inside Saint Bavo’s Cathedral?

sample_questions.subject: Mountains & Rivers
sample_questions.question: Which river carves the Iron Gate gorge between Serbia and Romania as part of its Danube course?

sample_questions.subject: National Flags
sample_questions.question: Which East African country adopted a flag in 1962 featuring a grey crowned crane within a white disc?

sample_questions.subject: Islands & Archipelagos
sample_questions.question: Which archipelago includes Pico Island crowned by Portugal’s highest volcanic peak?

sample_questions.subject: UNESCO Sites
sample_questions.question: Which Turkish site preserving Hittite capital remains was inscribed as a World Heritage Site in 1986?

sample_questions.subject: Deserts & Oceans
sample_questions.question: Which coastal desert stretching along Namibia and Angola is sustained by fog from the Benguela Current?

sample_questions.subject: Airports & Airlines
sample_questions.question: Which airport opened in 1998 on Chek Lap Kok island to replace Kai Tak as Hong Kong’s main international hub?

sample_questions.subject: Trains & Journeys
sample_questions.question: Which luxury service launched in 1883 connected Paris to Constantinople via the Simplon Tunnel variant after 1919?

sample_questions.subject: Countries by Cuisine
sample_questions.question: Which nation’s cuisine features injera flatbread made from teff and served with wats like doro wat?

sample_questions.subject: Odd Place Names
sample_questions.question: Which English village in Dorset shares its name with a prehistoric earthwork, giving rise to ‘Cerne Abbas Giant’?

sample_questions.subject: Classical Art
sample_questions.question: Which sculptor carved the Parian marble statue of Hermes carrying infant Dionysus discovered at Olympia in 1877?

sample_questions.subject: Modern Art Movements
sample_questions.question: Which manifesto published in Milan in 1909 by Filippo Tommaso Marinetti launched Futurism’s celebration of speed and machines?

sample_questions.subject: Architecture & Design
sample_questions.question: Which Japanese architect designed the Sendai Mediatheque with tubular steel lattice columns inspired by seaweed forms?
